title: Ipsilateral femoral neck and shaft fractures fixation with proximal femoral nail antirotation II (PFNA II): technical note and cases series
patient: The patient is a 30-year-old male who had traumatic event of traffic accident. Radiography and CT of the pelvis were arranged and showed the right femur middle shaft transverse fracture AO 32A3 with ipsilateral femoral neck fracture Garden type III and Pauwel’s classification type III (72°), AO31B2.3. Besides, the right patella subluxation was also found (Fig. a, b).\nSurgical intervention of ORIF with PFNA II (10 × 380 mm; blade,110 mm) was performed for the ipsilateral femoral neck and shaft fracture on the day of the trauma. Fluoroscopic view during operation revealed well alignment of both femoral neck and shaft fracture (Fig. c,d).
